candidates.title: chore(deps): bump hyper from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [hyper](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper) from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper's releases.

v1.2.0

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
      • NOTE: The default for this will change in v1.3 to something conservative. If you have an environment where the server can always accept a large amount of concurrent streams, and depend on that for performance, you should set this option manually.
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong. (7206fe30)

New Contributors

  • @​getong made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3503
  • @​dsgallups made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3507
  • @​magurotuna made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3524
  • @​erebe made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3536
  • @​wfly1998 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3523

v1.1.0

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

New Contributors

  • @​acedogblast made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3433
  • @​hatoo made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3434
  • @​allan2 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3449
  • @​daxhuiberts made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3464
  • @​ncihnegn made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3479

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from hyper's changelog.

v1.2.0 (2024-02-21)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong.

(7206fe30)

v1.1.0 (2023-12-18)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

v1.0.1 (2023-11-16)

This release "fixes" or adds a few things that should have been in 1.0.0, but were forgotten. Thus, it includes additions that would normally be a semver-minor release, but because it is so close to 1.0.0, it is released as a patch version.

Bug Fixes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 198c1b9 v1.2.0
  • a7bdc60 refactor(lib): importing Unpin is not needed in 2021 edition
  • 00a703a chore(ci): update to cargo-check-external-types 0.1.11
  • b0c1395 refactor(error): resolve unused trait error
  • 7206fe3 fix(rt): Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime
  • 90eb95f chore(lib): remove importing prelude trait in 2021 edition (#3546)
  • b114244 feat(http1): support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3...
  • 7177770 chore(lib): update to 2021 edition
  • 7a0a640 docs(maintainers): add dswij (@​dswij) to triagers (#3540)
  • 79862ec fix(http2): typo in trace logging (#3536)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: refactor: remove ldk node in fedimint-testing
candidates.body: The LDK implementation we use for testing right now is currently flaky and does not add much coverage anyway. We are going to be adding LDK as a first-class citizen in the gateway (https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4338), in which case we will actually have two implementations of similar interfaces for LDK. I think it makes sense to just remove the existing LDK implementation that is only used for testing and work towards supporting `ldk-node` inside of the gateway.

candidates.title: chore: `meta` module
candidates.body:
## Overview

Meta module is meant to allow guardians to collectively setup and change over time a set of values for various auxiliary purposes, e.g.: establish customization of Federation like welcome messages, ToS and other legal documents, references to community information, chat servers, etc. This way the end user Fedimint client applications can discover these settings and customize the user experience per-federation. 

It acts as a simple key-value store, where each guardian can submit a proposed value for a given key, and if `threshold` number of peers submit the same value, it becomes an official consensus.

This module is intentionally simple and limited in scope.

The keys are effectively a single byte, so there can only ever be 256 of them. Server side module does not interpret these values in any way and treats them as opaque binary blobs.

It is up to the community of Fedimint end user applications to establish the meaning and format of meta module values. The initial intention is to use a single key with the value of a json string. The structure of that JSON document is open-ended and can be estabilished and evolved over time, and applications can gracefully handle it in backward and forward compatible way.

This is all to move the more social consensus around Federation management outside / on top-of the hard to evolve Fedimint consensus.

The extra 255 keys are an escape hatch - to avoid dealing with module consensus changes if a single value ever turns out to not be enough.

We should follow up with some partitioning and allocation of these keys, and the Json schema for ones deemed to be used as Json (default one 0 at least).

## Testing

`just mprocs` and then try:

```
fedimint-cli module meta help
fedimint-cli --our-id 1 --password asdf module meta submit '{ "a": "b"}'
fedimint-cli --our-id 1 --password asdf module meta get-submissions
```

etc.

See if you can figure it out. :)

### References

* https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/tree/master/docs/meta_fields

### Status

I think everything is there. Now needs some feedback, tests, fixes and merging.

For reviewers - there are some nifty details and improvements that I accumulated along the way. Some of them pushed as separate PRs already, some integral to the change.

TODO:

* [ ] write some (devimint?) tests
* [ ] fix back-compat - probably something about new module

candidates.title: chore: add `fedimint-empty` module
candidates.body:
Initiaially the goal of `fedimint-dummy` module was to be a good template to start a new module.

But with time, it was hijacked to be become `fedimint-`"print me money out of thin air" module (aka `fedimint-federal-reserve` module), and it now actually contains quite a bit of code.

So when trying to use it as a starting point, one needs to go a rename, delete and fix more code than neccessary.

This module is a clone of `fedimint-dummy`, but with almost everything removed.

It will get compiled, but will not be used for anything anywhere.

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump tempfile from 3.10.0 to 3.10.1
candidates.body:
Bumps [tempfile](https://github.com/Stebalien/tempfile) from 3.10.0 to 3.10.1.
Changelog

Sourced from tempfile's changelog.

3.10.1

  • Handle potential integer overflows in 32-bit systems when seeking/truncating "spooled" temporary files past 4GiB (2³²).
  • Handle a theoretical 32-bit overflow when generating a temporary file name larger than 4GiB. Now it'll panic (on allocation failure) rather than silently succeeding due to wraparound.

Thanks to @​stoeckmann for finding and fixing both of these issues.

Commits
  • 094c115 chore: release 3.10.1
  • 56c5934 Fix integer overflows and truncation (#278)
  • 5a949d6 chore: 2021 edition (#276)
  • See full diff in compare view

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump async-channel from 1.9.0 to 2.2.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [async-channel](https://github.com/smol-rs/async-channel) from 1.9.0 to 2.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from async-channel's releases.

v2.2.0

  • Bump event-listener to v5.0.0. (#79)
  • Bump MSRV to 1.60. (#80)

v2.1.1

  • Bump event-listener to v4.0.0. (#73)

v2.1.0

  • Bump futures-lite to its latest version. (#70)

v2.0.0

  • Breaking: Make Send, Recv and Receiver !Unpin. This enables more efficient event notification strategies. (#59)
  • Breaking: Add an std enabled-by-default feature that enables parts of the API that require std. (#59)
  • Add support for the wasm32 target. (#67)

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump jsonrpsee-types from 0.21.0 to 0.22.2
candidates.body:
Bumps [jsonrpsee-types](https://github.com/paritytech/jsonrpsee) from 0.21.0 to 0.22.2.
Release notes

Sourced from jsonrpsee-types's releases.

v0.22.2

[v0.22.2] - 2024-03-05

This is a small patch release that exposes the connection details to server methods without breaking changes. Currently, users can only retrieve the connection ID from these details. We plan to extend this functionality in jsonrpsee v1.0, although this will necessitate a breaking change.

[Added]

  • server: Register raw method with connection ID (#1297)

[Changed]

  • Update Syn 1.0 -> 2.0 (#1304)

v0.22.1

[v0.22.1] - 2024-02-19

This is a small patch release that internally changes AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize to support more targets.

[Fixed]

  • fix(docs): part of proc-macro documentation not rendering correctly in IDE (#1294)
  • fix(client): change to AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize (#1293)
  • fix(server): low-level API return err on WS handshake err (#1288)

v0.22.0

[v0.22.0] - 2024-02-07

Another breaking release where a new ResponsePayload type is introduced in order to make it possible to determine whether a response has been processed.

Unfortunately, the IntoResponse trait was modified to enable that and some minor changes were made to make more fields private to avoid further breakage.

Example of the async ResponsePayload API

#[rpc(server)]
pub trait Api {
	#[method(name = "x")]
	fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String>;
}

impl RpcServer for () {
fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String> {
let (rp, rp_done) = ResponsePayload::success("ehheeheh".to_string()).notify_on_completion();


	tokio::spawn(async move {
		if rp_done.await.is_ok() {
			do_task_that_depend_x();



</tr></table>

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from jsonrpsee-types's changelog.

[v0.22.2] - 2024-03-05

This is a small patch release that exposes the connection details in server method implementations without breaking changes. We plan to extend this functionality in jsonrpsee v1.0, although this will necessitate a breaking change.

[Added]

  • server: Register raw method with connection ID (#1297)

[Changed]

  • Update Syn 1.0 -> 2.0 (#1304)

[v0.22.1] - 2024-02-19

This is a small patch release that internally changes AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize to support more targets.

[Fixed]

  • fix(docs): part of proc-macro documentation not rendering correctly in IDE (#1294)
  • fix(client): change to AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize (#1293)
  • fix(server): low-level API return err on WS handshake err (#1288)

[v0.22.0] - 2024-02-07

Another breaking release where a new ResponsePayload type is introduced in order to make it possible to determine whether a response has been processed.

Unfortunately, the IntoResponse trait was modified to enable that and some minor changes were made to make more fields private to avoid further breakage.

Example of the async ResponsePayload API

#[rpc(server)]
pub trait Api {
	#[method(name = "x")]
	fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String>;
}

impl RpcServer for () {
fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String> {
let (rp, rp_done) = ResponsePayload::success("ehheeheh".to_string()).notify_on_completion();


	tokio::spawn(async move {
		if rp_done.await.is_ok() {
			do_task_that_depend_x();
		}
	});

	rp



</tr></table>

... (truncated)

candidates.title: chore(deps): bump http from 0.2.11 to 1.1.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [http](https://github.com/hyperium/http) from 0.2.11 to 1.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from http's releases.

v1.1.0

What's Changed

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Add Extensions::get_or_insert() method.
  • Implement From<Uri> for uri::Builder.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.

New Contributors

  • @​tottoto made their first contribution in hyperium/http#645
  • @​julianbraha made their first contribution in hyperium/http#652
  • @​LukeMathWalker made their first contribution in hyperium/http#654
  • @​mattgathu made their first contribution in hyperium/http#660
  • @​LukasKalbertodt made their first contribution in hyperium/http#667
  • @​dswij made their first contribution in hyperium/http#673

Full Changelog: https://github.com/hyperium/http/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

v1.0.0

What's Changed

  • Implement Clone for Request, Response, and Extensions. This breaking change requires that all extensions now implement Clone.
  • Add a default-on std feature. Disabling it currently is not supported.
  • Fix MIRI warnings in HeaderMap::iter().

New Contributors

  • @​hjr3 made their first contribution in hyperium/http#644

v0.2.12

What's Changed

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.
Changelog

Sourced from http's changelog.

1.1.0 (March 4, 2024)

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Add Extensions::get_or_insert() method.
  • Implement From<Uri> for uri::Builder.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.

1.0.0 (November 15, 2023)

  • Implement Clone for Request, Response, and Extensions. This breaking change requires that all extensions now implement Clone.
  • Add a default-on std feature. Disabling it currently is not supported.
  • Fix MIRI warnings in HeaderMap::iter().

0.2.10 (November 10, 2023)

  • Fix parsing of Authority to handle square brackets in incorrect order.
  • Fix HeaderMap::with_capacity() to handle arithmetic overflow.

0.2.9 (February 17, 2023)

  • Add HeaderName constants for cache-status and cdn-cache-control.
  • Implement Hash for PathAndQuery.
  • Re-export HeaderName at crate root.

0.2.8 (June 6, 2022)

  • Fix internal usage of uninitialized memory to use MaybeUninit inside HeaderName.

0.2.7 (April 28, 2022)

  • MSRV bumped to 1.49.
  • Add extend() method to Extensions.
  • Add From<Authority> and From<PathAndQuery> impls for Uri.
  • Make HeaderName::from_static a const fn.

0.2.6 (December 30, 2021)

  • Upgrade internal itoa dependency to 1.0.

0.2.5 (September 21, 2021)

  • Add is_empty() and len() methods to Extensions.
  • Add version_ref() method to request::Builder.
  • Implement TryFrom<Vec<u8>> and TryFrom<String> for Authority, Uri, PathAndQuery, and HeaderName.
  • Make HeaderValue::from_static a const fn.

0.2.4 (April 4, 2021)

  • Fix Uri parsing to allow {, ", and } in paths.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 3fe7267 v1.1.0
  • 96dc52f fix: HeaderName::from_lowercase allowing NUL bytes in some cases
  • caa8b4f feat: add HeaderMap::try_ methods to handle capacity overflow
  • 63102bc chore(lib): remove importing prelude AsRef trait
  • c03cc8b chore(header): allow clippy::should_implement_trait rule for HeaderValue::fro...
  • 4785cdd refactor(header): rename method to follow naming convention
  • 63e7d63 doc(header): add panics and safety section to document
  • b8ddea7 refactor(header): add comment and lint allowing to panic in const context wor...
  • fe1932d refactor(status): remove redundant static lifetime
  • 79f8da5 refactor(header): ownership is not needed to iterate
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=http&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.2.11&new-version=1.1.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. chosen_pr.title: chore(deps): bump hyper from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0
chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [hyper](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper) from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper's releases.

v1.2.0

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
      • NOTE: The default for this will change in v1.3 to something conservative. If you have an environment where the server can always accept a large amount of concurrent streams, and depend on that for performance, you should set this option manually.
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong. (7206fe30)

New Contributors

  • @​getong made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3503
  • @​dsgallups made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3507
  • @​magurotuna made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3524
  • @​erebe made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3536
  • @​wfly1998 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3523

v1.1.0

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

New Contributors

  • @​acedogblast made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3433
  • @​hatoo made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3434
  • @​allan2 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3449
  • @​daxhuiberts made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3464
  • @​ncihnegn made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3479

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from hyper's changelog.

v1.2.0 (2024-02-21)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong.

(7206fe30)

v1.1.0 (2023-12-18)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

v1.0.1 (2023-11-16)

This release "fixes" or adds a few things that should have been in 1.0.0, but were forgotten. Thus, it includes additions that would normally be a semver-minor release, but because it is so close to 1.0.0, it is released as a patch version.

Bug Fixes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 198c1b9 v1.2.0
  • a7bdc60 refactor(lib): importing Unpin is not needed in 2021 edition
  • 00a703a chore(ci): update to cargo-check-external-types 0.1.11
  • b0c1395 refactor(error): resolve unused trait error
  • 7206fe3 fix(rt): Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime
  • 90eb95f chore(lib): remove importing prelude trait in 2021 edition (#3546)
  • b114244 feat(http1): support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3...
  • 7177770 chore(lib): update to 2021 edition
  • 7a0a640 docs(maintainers): add dswij (@​dswij) to triagers (#3540)
  • 79862ec fix(http2): typo in trace logging (#3536)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=hyper&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.14.28&new-version=1.2.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
